work.name: Venetian Macau Ltd
work.summary: • Conducted daily inspections across multiple raw & domestic water rooms, ensuring optimal temperature, pressure, and chlorine dioxide controller levels. Addressed 50+ issues and optimized water pump head pressure calculations using Affinity Law • Worked alongside expert technicians to inspect and maintain the hotel's centralized control systems • Identified and resolved 10+ control system malfunctions using electrical engineering principles

work.name: Engineering Intern
work.summary: • Conducted physical simulations to measure output force over time for a single seismic source. Discovered increasing attenuation with rising scanning frequencies. Collaborated with PetroChina Saudi Arabia personnel to delve into specifics, verifying similar issues with other controllers • Performed sandwich tests to understand the relationship between plate and hammer acceleration signals and output force. Detected significant phase differences impacting force attenuation, providing insights that steered R&D efforts towards transformer signal improvements and enhanced filtering

projects.name: Development and Testing of a Mobile Manipulation Robot
projects.summary: In this project, a mobile manipulation robot, designed specifically for automating tasks in library environments is presented supervised by Prof. Qingsong Xu. Libot combines the functionalities of the UR5 robotic arm and MiR250 mobile platform, enhanced with a Realsense 435i depth camera, to autonomously navigate and interact within a library setting. The whole project is generated by Mr.Jiang Dechao ane me
